Copilot for Teams

Copilot in Teams keeps you informed during and after meetings, summarizes chats and channels, and helps you ask natural‑language questions about what’s been discussed or decided.

Great for

  • Real‑time meeting summaries, action items, and decisions
  • Generating post‑meeting recaps and follow‑up lists
  • Summarizing busy channels and threads to the essentials
  • Answering questions like “What did we decide about X?” across chats
Example prompt: “During this meeting, capture key decisions and owners. At the end, produce a recap with next steps and risks. Share in the channel.”
Tips: Mention which meeting or channel to summarize. Ask for owners and deadlines explicitly. Request a short version (<150 words) for execs and a detailed version for the team.

Common scenarios

  • Catching up on a project channel before a stand‑up
  • Preparing a one‑page recap for leadership after a review
  • Drafting meeting invites with agenda and pre‑reads
High‑level overview prepared for quick onboarding.
